fr.zelus.jarvis.core

Class JarvisCore

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.zelus.jarvis.core.JarvisCore

  • public class JarvisCore
extends Object
    The core component of the jarvis framework.

    This class is constructed from an OrchestrationModel, that defines the Intent to Action bindings that are executed by the application. Constructing an instance of this class will load the JarvisModules used by the provided OrchestrationModel, and enable the corresponding JarvisActions. It also creates an instance of EventDefinitionRegistry that can be accessed to retrieve and manage EventDefinition .

    See Also:
    EventDefinitionRegistry, JarvisModuleRegistry, OrchestrationService, JarvisModule

    • Constructor Detail

      • JarvisCore

        public JarvisCore(Configuration configuration)
        Constructs a new JarvisCore instance from the provided configuration.

        The provided configuration must provide values for the following key (note that additional values may be required according to the used EventProviders and JarvisModules):

        • jarvis.orchestration.model: the OrchestrationModel defining the Intent to Action bindings (or the string representing its location)

        The provided OrchestrationModel defines the Intent to Action bindings that are executed by the application. This constructor takes care of loading the JarvisModules associated to the provided orchestrationModel and enables the corresponding JarvisActions.

        Note: the JarvisModules associated to the provided orchestrationModel have to be in the classpath in order to be dynamically loaded and instantiated.

        Parameters:
        configuration - the Configuration to construct the instance from
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided configuration or one of the mandatory values is null
        JarvisException - if the framework is not able to retrieve the OrchestrationModel
        See Also:
        OrchestrationModel

    • Method Detail

      • getOrchestrationModel

        protected OrchestrationModel getOrchestrationModel(Object property)
        Retrieves the OrchestrationModel from the provided property.

        This method checks if the provided property is already an in-memory OrchestrationModel instance, or if it is defined by a String or an URI representing the path of the model. In that case, the method attempts to load the model at the provided location and returns it.

        This method supports loading of model path defined by Strings and URIs. Support for additional types is planned in the next releases.

        Parameters:
        property - the Object representing the OrchestrationModel to extract
        Returns:
        the OrchestrationModel from the provided property
        Throws:
        JarvisException - if the provided property type is not handled, if the underlying Resource cannot be loaded or if it does not contain an OrchestrationModel top-level element, or if the loaded OrchestrationModel is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the provided property is null

      • getDialogFlowApi

        public DialogFlowApi getDialogFlowApi()
        Returns the DialogFlowApi used to query the DialogFlow framework.

        Note: this method is designed to ease debugging and testing, direct interactions with the DialogFlow API may create consistency issues. In particular, jarvis does not ensure that JarvisActions will be triggered in case of direct queries to the DialogFlow API.

        Returns:
        the DialogFlowApi used to query the DialogFlow framework

      • getEventDefinitionRegistry

        public EventDefinitionRegistry getEventDefinitionRegistry()
        Returns the EventDefinitionRegistry associated to this instance.

        This registry is used to cache EventDefinitions and IntentDefinitions from the input OrchestrationModel and provides utility methods to retrieve specific EventDefinition and IntentDefinition and clear the cache.

        Returns:
        the EventDefinitionRegistry associated to this instance

      • getJarvisModuleRegistry

        public JarvisModuleRegistry getJarvisModuleRegistry()
        Returns the JarvisModuleRegistry associated to this instance.

        This registry is used to cache loaded module, and provides utility method to retrieve, unregister, and clear them.

        Returns:
        the JarvisModuleRegistry associated to this instance

      • getOrchestrationModel

        public OrchestrationModel getOrchestrationModel()
        Returns the OrchestrationModel associated to this class' OrchestrationService.

        This method eases the access to the underlying OrchestrationModel for client applications.

        Returns:
        the OrchestrationModel associated to this class' OrchestrationService
        See Also:
        OrchestrationService.getOrchestrationModel()

      • getExecutorService

        protected ExecutorService getExecutorService()
        Returns the ExecutorService used to process JarvisActions.

        Note: this method is designed to ease testing, and should not be accessed by client applications. Manipulating JarvisCore's ExecutorService may create consistency issues on currently executed JarvisActions.

        Returns:
        the ExecutorService used to process JarvisActions

      • getJarvisServer

        protected JarvisServer getJarvisServer()
        Returns the JarvisServer used to capture incoming webhooks.
        Returns:
        the JarvisServer used to capture incoming webhooks

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shuts down the JarvisCore and the underlying engines.

        This method shuts down the underlying DialogFlowApi, unloads and shuts down all the JarvisModules associated to this instance, unregisters the EventDefinition from the associated EventDefinitionRegistry, and shuts down the executorService and jarvisServer.

        Note: calling this method invalidates the DialogFlow connection, and thus shuts down intent detections and voice recognitions features. New JarvisActions cannot be processed either.

        See Also:
        JarvisModule.shutdown(), DialogFlowApi.shutdown()

      • isShutdown

        public boolean isShutdown()
        Returns whether the JarvisCore client is shutdown.

        This class is considered as shutdown if either its underlying ExecutorService or DialogFlowApi is shutdown, or if its SessionName is null.

        Returns:
        true if the JarvisCore client is shutdown, false otherwise

      • getOrCreateJarvisSession

        public JarvisSession getOrCreateJarvisSession(String sessionId)
        Retrieves or creates the JarvisSession associated to the provided sessionId.

        If the JarvisSession does not exist a new one is created using DialogFlowApi.createSession(String).

        See getOrCreateJarvisSession(String, JarvisSession) to create or retrieve a JarvisSession and merge its context with an existing JarvisSession.

        Parameters:
        sessionId - the identifier to get or retrieve a session from
        Returns:
        the JarvisSession associated to the provided sessionId
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided sessionId is null

      • getOrCreateJarvisSession

        public JarvisSession getOrCreateJarvisSession(String sessionId,
                                              JarvisSession baseSession)
        Retrieves or creates the JarvisSession associated to the provided sessionId, and merges its context with the provided baseSession.

        This method allows to create JarvisSession filled with initial context values, that can be set by EventProvider instances not tailored to a specific session (e.g. WebhookEventProvider). Calling this method is equivalent to getOrCreateJarvisSession(sessionId).merge(baseSession.getJarvisContext()).

        Parameters:
        sessionId - the identifier to get or retrieve the session from
        baseSession - the JarvisSession to merge in the retrieved one
        Returns:
        the JarvisSession associated to the provided sessionId, with its context variables merged from the provided baseSession
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided sessionId is null

      • getJarvisSession

        public JarvisSession getJarvisSession(String sessionId)
        Returns the JarvisSession associated to the provided sessionId
        Parameters:
        sessionId - the identifier to retrieve the session from
        Returns:
        the JarvisSession associated to the provided sessionId
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided sessionId is null
